job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: MUST HAVES:-           5+ Python software development for composition and modularity, debugging and following tracebacks-           Strong stats background and concepts including hypothesis testing, correlation, R squared, P-value-           Experience with Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Pytorch -           Tensorflow functional API, deep learning-           Mathematics of machine learning- linear algebra, multivariable calculus -           SQL querying -           Hyperparameter optimization, regularizing regression models PLUSSES:-           Masters or PhD- HIGHLY preferred!! -           Ecommerce experience  DAY TO DAY:   A company is looking for a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to sit remotely within the US. We follow industry standard practices for managing, collaboration, deployment and testing. We deploy and interact with resources on AWS. Responsibilities include:• Analyze large data sets by quantifying the data quality, identifying particular patterns, and visualizing results • Understand business problems and identify the right data sets and ML/Statistical approach to produce the desired outcomes • Adapt to account for changes and be able to propose alternative approaches • Ideate and develop analytics and modeling solutions cross-functionally to build customized, long-term, and sustainable solutions • Provide critical thought leadership and enhance organizational capabilities • Own machine learning pipelines end-to-end • Write production-grade machine learning code using standard engineering practices and deploy models to production • Improve codebase and lead/participate in code reviews with Research Scientists and Data Scientists • Help non-engineers develop their engineering skills • Mentor junior team members and contribute to a culture where everyone is valued
